conclusion: To determine which container (E or F) the liquid will flow into after passing through the baffles, we need to analyze the paths from points A, B, C, and D.
A is connected to a red baffle.
The red baffle directs the liquid downward.
The liquid will flow into the container on the left, which is E.
B is connected to a green baffle.
The green baffle directs the liquid downward.
The liquid will flow into the container on the left, which is E.
C is connected to a blue baffle.
The blue baffle directs the liquid downward.
The liquid will flow into the container on the right, which is F.
D is connected to a yellow baffle.
The yellow baffle directs the liquid downward.
The liquid will flow into the container on the right, which is F.
Liquids from A and B will flow into container E.
Liquids from C and D will flow into container F.
The liquid from A and B will flow into container E, and the liquid from C and D will flow into container F.
